passage_text: Subtract numbers in a range. To do this task, use the SUM function. Adding a negative number is the same as subtracting. Note There is no SUBTRACT function in Excel. Use the SUM function and convert any numbers that you want to subtract to their negative values. For example, SUM(100,-32,15,-6) returns 77.

Subtract numbers in a range. To do this task, use the SUM function. Adding a negative number is the same as subtracting. Note There is no SUBTRACT function in Excel. Use the SUM function and convert any numbers that you want to subtract to their negative values. For example, SUM(100,-32,15,-6) returns 77.

To subtract two or more numbers in Excel you need to create a formula. Important points to remember about Excel formulas: 1  Formulas in Excel always begin with the equal sign 2  (=). The equal sign is always typed into the cell where you want the answer to appear. 3  The subtraction sign in Excel is the dash (-).
